greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A divisor-or-multiple permutation of natural numbers: a(n) = A052330(A006068(n)).
comment: Shares with A064736, A207901, A302781, A302350, etc. a property that a(n) is always either a divisor or a multiple of a(n+1). However, because multiple bits may change simultaneously when moving from A006068(n) to A006068(n+1) [with the restriction that the changing bits are all either toggled on or all toggled off], it means that also here the terms might be divided or multiplied by more than just a single Fermi-Dirac prime (A050376). E.g. a(3) = 3, while a(4) = A050376(1) * A050376(3) * 3 = 2*4*3 = 24. See also comments in A284003.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..8191
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
program: i = 0; for(n=1,oo,if(A302777(n), i++; v050376[i] = n); if(i == up_to_e,break));
A006068(n)= { my(s=1, ns); while(1, ns = n >> s; if(0==ns, break()); n = bitxor(n, ns); s <<= 1; ); return (n); } \\ From A006068
xref: Cf. also A207901 and A284003 (a squarefree analog).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Apr 16 2018
